reasons_to_visit.details: Experience Finland's unique and massive Vappu celebration (April 30th eve & May 1st). Witness the student cap-placing ceremony, enjoy picnics in Kaivopuisto, and soak up the carnival atmosphere.
May brings true spring to Helsinki (average highs ~15°C/59°F). Parks turn green, flowers bloom (especially tulips in parks, cherry blossoms in Roihuvuori), and daylight hours rapidly lengthen.
Enjoy the return of outdoor seating at cafes and restaurants across the city. Sip coffee on Esplanadi or enjoy drinks by the sea as terrace season kicks off.
Ferry services to Suomenlinna are frequent, and services to recreational islands like Pihlajasaari often begin, allowing for early summer island exploration.
Outside the very busy Vappu period, May offers pleasant weather with fewer tourists and potentially better prices than peak summer, ideal for museums and sightseeing.
With improving weather and longer days, May is great for exploring Helsinki's parks, coastline, and different neighborhoods on foot or by city bike.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: Vappu (April 30th eve & May 1st) brings enormous crowds, especially downtown and in Kaivopuisto. Accommodation prices soar, and many shops/services close on May 1st.
May weather is unpredictable. While often pleasant, expect potential cold snaps, rain, and wind. Pack layers, including waterproofs.
May 1st is a major public holiday with widespread closures (shops, Alko, banks, many museums). Public transport runs on a Sunday schedule.
Ascension Day (Helatorstai) often falls in May (date varies). This public holiday creates a long weekend, increasing local travel and causing shop closures.
Birch pollen season often peaks in May, significantly affecting allergy sufferers.
While islands become accessible, the Baltic Sea remains very cold for swimming.

weather.precipitation: Variable spring weather. Mix of sun, cloud, and showers likely. Nights can still be cold. Daylight hours increase rapidly.
weather.general_tips: Layers are key: T-shirts, sweaters/fleece, waterproof/windproof jacket. Comfortable walking shoes. Sunglasses. Allergy medication if needed. Be prepared for Vappu festivities/closures.

tourism_level.crowds: Extremely high around April 30th/May 1st (Vappu). Moderate otherwise, increasing week by week. Shoulder season feel outside Vappu.
tourism_level.pricing: Peak prices for Vappu weekend (book months ahead). Shoulder/High season prices otherwise, increasing from April.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Dominated by Vappu celebrations early on. Afterwards, a city bursting into spring green, lively terraces, and growing optimism for summer.

events_holidays.name: Vappu Eve (Vappuaatto)
events_holidays.description: Main event is the Havis Amanda statue capping ceremony near Market Square, attracting huge crowds. Student celebrations throughout the city.
events_holidays.notes: City center extremely crowded. Plan movement accordingly. Festive, noisy atmosphere.

events_holidays.name: Vappu / May Day (Vappupäivä)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday. Traditional picnic day, especially massive gathering in Kaivopuisto park. Political marches also occur.
events_holidays.notes: Widespread closures (shops, Alko, banks). Public transport on Sunday schedule. Kaivopuisto is packed.

events_holidays.name: Mother's Day (Äitienpäivä)
events_holidays.description: Family-oriented day. Many restaurants offer special brunches/menus.
events_holidays.notes: Book restaurants well in advance if planning a special meal.

events_holidays.name: Ascension Day (Helatorstai) (If applicable)
events_holidays.date: Varies (Thursday, 40 days after Easter - often early/mid May)

unique_experiences.where: Market Square area (April 30th eve), Kaivopuisto Park (May 1st)
unique_experiences.description: Witness the unique Finnish May Day traditions: student cap ceremony, massive picnic gatherings, balloons, streamers, festive food & drink (like 'sima' and 'tippaleipä').
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Be prepared for huge crowds and potential transport detours. Embrace the party atmosphere. May 1st picnic is weather-dependent but happens regardless!

unique_experiences.description: Visit the Roihuvuori Cherry Tree Park ('Kirsikkapuisto') during its brief but beautiful blooming period (timing varies, usually early/mid May).
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check local reports/social media for peak bloom status ('Hanami'). Accessible by metro/bus. Can get crowded during peak bloom weekends.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the UNESCO site as spring arrives. Explore the grounds, museums, and enjoy the sea air as more services open up.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Ferry runs frequently. Wear comfortable shoes. Pack layers.

unique_experiences.activity: Enjoy Coffee on an Esplanadi Terrace
unique_experiences.description: Sit at an outdoor cafe along the Esplanadi boulevard, enjoy the spring sunshine (hopefully!), and watch the city come back to life.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Iconic Helsinki experience. Can be pricey but great atmosphere.

weather.precipitation: Often brings more stable and pleasant spring weather, but still variable. Good chance of sunny days. Daylight hours are very long.
weather.general_tips: Layers still recommended, but focus shifts more towards lighter spring wear. Waterproof jacket always wise. Sunscreen needed.

tourism_level.crowds: High season building. Noticeably busier than early May (post-Vappu), but quieter than July/August.
tourism_level.pricing: High season prices generally apply. Book popular attractions/tours in advance.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Beautiful late spring. City is green and vibrant. Long evenings encourage outdoor activities. Great time for exploring before peak summer.

events_holidays.name: Helsinki City Running Day (Potential - Check Dates)
events_holidays.date: Usually a Saturday in mid/late May
events_holidays.description: Major running event featuring marathon, half-marathon, and shorter distances. Affects traffic and brings many participants to the city.
events_holidays.notes: Check exact date. Expect road closures and crowds near route/finish line (Olympic Stadium area).

events_holidays.name: Ascension Day (Helatorstai) (If applicable)
events_holidays.date: Varies (Thursday, 40 days after Easter - often mid/late May)

unique_experiences.description: Explore historic wooden buildings relocated from around Finland in a beautiful island setting. Opens fully for the summer season usually in May.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Accessible by bus then footbridge. Allow several hours. Cafe on site. Check opening times for buildings.

unique_experiences.where: Island south of Helsinki, ferry from Merisatama/Ruoholahti
unique_experiences.description: Take a ferry to this popular recreational island known for its beaches, rocks, nature trails, and old villas. Great for picnics.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check ferry schedule (usually starts mid/late May). Bring own food/drinks or use island cafe/restaurant (check opening). Swimwear if brave!
unique_experiences.best_time: Sunny day, allow half a day

unique_experiences.where: Various routes (e.g., towards Lauttasaari or East Helsinki)
unique_experiences.description: Rent a city bike or personal bike and explore the scenic coastal paths, enjoying the fresh air and long daylight hours.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: City bike system (HSL) is easy to use. Many dedicated bike paths. Plan route beforehand.
unique_experiences.estimated_cost: Low (city bike rental) to Moderate (private rental)

unique_experiences.activity: Day Trip to Nuuksio National Park
unique_experiences.description: Hike trails through forests and around lakes in this beautiful national park near Helsinki as paths become drier.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Take bus to Haltia Nature Centre or trailheads. Wear good walking shoes. Bring water/snacks. Check bus schedules.
